title.narrative: WASH EPR:SCHOOL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), SANITATION AND HYGIENE

description.narrative: Relevant MDAs, LGAs, and NSAs are prepared, have adequate sectoral capacity and provide an effective intra coordinated response in WASH in emergencies., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equitable and sustainable access and use of safe water supply, improved sanitation and appropriate hygiene practices in rural and peri-urban schools and communities

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant MDAs, LGAs, and NSAs are prepared, have adequate sectoral capacity and provide an effective intra coordinated response in WASH in emergencies.

description.narrative: In responding to Humanitarian actions, WASH programme is guided by UNICEF Core Commitments for Children that ensure protected and reliable access to sufficient, safe water and sanitation and hygiene facilities in places of abode as well as in learning environment and in child-friendly spaces. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: WASH sector provides coordinated emergency response

baseline.value: Insufficientinformation/ records tracking number of populations served in emergencies

target.value: 2016:Response to 75% of emergencies with over 50,000 affected people

actual.value: 2016:Response to two major emergencies (cholera and refugees) adequately provided providing life serving interventions to 1,917,129 children 1,841,950 women.
